Sharing the words of Google recruiter Elizabeth Morgan:

"At an old company I volunteered to greet candidates when they came in for onsite interviews. I'd give a quick tour, make them coffee, take their coats, etc. I LOVED getting to know people and easing their interview nerves.

"One leadership candidate came in and before I could even introduce myself, they handed me their coat and asked me for a water. It made me feel so small and uncomfortable.

"After they left for the day I sat in on the hiring team conversation like I always did. Our leadership team was REALLY excited about this person. 

"I decided to bring up my interaction with the candidate and the energy in the room grew somber. Other folks started talking about how they also noticed the candidate gave off (on several occasions) red flags about their ability to be a team player. Within 5 minutes this candidate had gone from an IN THE BAG HIRE, to‚Ä¶ let's call them tomorrow to let them know we won't be moving forward. 

"There's so much that goes into a hiring decision. Your interview starts the moment you share your resume. Be aware of how your actions come across and how the company responds to them; it just may be the reason they don't move forward with you or YOU decide they aren't for YOU! :)"

#Jobsearch is not an easy task we understand but you should always keep some this in your mind while actively looking for a job:

1. Patience
Don‚Äôt stress out if you are not getting the required profile. Panicking will definitely ruin everything so be patient, your hard work will pay off.

2. Rejections
Rejections are a part of a job search and you should face it. Many people don't have the courage to face them and move forward towards their goals. 
Rejection will make you strong and confident as you will be well-experienced with personal interviews.

3. Keep Learning
Learning things will make you more knowledgeable and will help you stand out. Knowledge is never wasted. If it is not used in interviews it will definitely be helpful in the future.

4. Networking
Network! This is the best thing you should do while searching for a job. It will not only help you to get a new job but also you can showcase your skills to the ecosystem.

Everything in our hiring process is a parameter for choosing the right candidate - from application to their communications and appearance.
 
Some of the strategies we use are:

We test them for character ‚Äì Character is necessary, especially for team success. During interviews, we lookout for character. Granted, we may not be able to capture 100% character but tiny fragments usually become evident during our interactions with them

We look for skills and talents ‚Äì We evaluate talent, not resumes. Many experienced candidates only look good on paper. We test them on skills they claim to possess, and on tasks, they claim to have accomplished. We ask questions to determine the role they played in each task.

We try to understand what they're really looking for - Everyone wants to get paid, but no matter the amount of money they receive monthly, being on the wrong job is never going to make anyone happy. We ask questions to understand what makes them tick. To understand what makes each candidate tick, you have to test them on it, We try to understand why they left their previous jobs
